thread.title: Destination Wales: The rich history of Monmouth
thread.title_full: Destination Wales: The rich history of Monmouth | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Destination Wales: The rich history of Monmouth
text:
Nestled in the Wye Valley - Monmouth sits between the rivers Wye and Monnow.
The market town has a rich history - and is particularly proud of its famous sons.
This year, Monmouth was voted as one of the best places to live in the whole of the UK Watch the report from Alexandra Lodge below:
Play video Henry V was born in the town in 1387.
It was purely by accident because his father was hunting in the Forest of Dean just across the river, and his mother was on her way to meet him and came in here because it was a Lancastrian properly.
– Patricia Lynesmith, curator, Monmouth Castle Museum Another good man from Monmouth was motoring pioneer Charles Rolls.
A statue of Charles Rolls in the town square He died before his 33rd birthday. By that time he'd established the Rolls Royce car company. But by the time of 1910, he was one of the foremost aviators in the country.
– Susan Miles, Monmouth Museum The famous Monnow bridge Richard and Joy Morris have been running the family business at Ancre Hill for almost 10 years.
They built the first winery in Wales.
And say Monmouth's climate is key to their success.
Richard and Joy Morris credit the local climate with their success More: Get a taste of the Vale of Clwyd Last updated Mon 24 Aug 2015 Read more 4 updates Destination Wales: The delights on our doorstep Travel Wales
